ok i have 5 tanks on the field and i want them to move in a V pattern with BT...

it seems the tanks follow the leader (as said) but not like they used to so they don't stick in formation :/ it's like the leader has the followers on a leash like a couple dogs and it ends in my tanks crashing into each other when doing a U turn. when what they used to do is turn on the spot and keep formation :/

BT works by making all craft set as followers point along the same heading as the craft identified as being the leader, and attempt to keep the same speed between them. It doesn't make fleet and formation maneuvers. Just keep that in mind.

I'm wondering if you can use this to mirror, as Columbia says, above. It could make docking small vessels much easier.

In theory, if one were to add a mode where instead of mimicking the movements of the parent craft, it instead mimicked the negative of the parent craft's movements, then mirroring would be possible for things such as docking. I could even see the possibility of limiting the mirroring to relative-positioning only, so as to eliminate the issue of the follower trying to retreat from the parent craft when the parent is trying to dock while under the influence of other forces. This way, one could make a series of rockets/vessels that launch separately, but in sync with each other, and then dock while under power once gravity is less persistent and combine their thrust for more advanced stages.

I'm unsure how this could be done however. I maintain my own source folder for this mod, along with many others, and might have to look at it a bit when my school quarter ends.
